attributes.action: call on the UK government to support the resolution on the rule of law in Gabon
attributes.additional_details:
https://eeas.europa.eu/election-observation-missions/eom-gabon/421/election-observation-missions-eueoms_en
MEPs question President Bongo’s legitimacy, noting that the official 2016 presidential election results are "non-transparent and highly doubtful". They are deeply concerned about the unfolding violence which followed the proclamation of the results.
#Gabon
attributes.background:
One of the most concerning aspects of the crisis  relate to the constant human rights abuses and violence

   Ali Bongo didn't win the elections in August 2016

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. 

You'll need to give your full name to start a petition.
